column4: i tried to upgrade to 9.10 from 9.04 but got this error: http://pastie.org/700639
anybody know how to get over that hump ?
jordan_u thanks, how do i change that ?  /etc/apt/sources.list ?
jordan_u I don't see software sources as an option
do: gksudo gedit /etc/apt/sources.list
change the line, save and then do: sudo apt-get update
and then try to upgrade again
k thanks trying...
sorry http://pastie.org/700646  do you know how to unlock it ?
close synaptic or software center, if oyu have them open
or the update manager
oh hehe ^^;
still getting that error... W:Failed to fetch http://archive.canonical.com/ubuntu/dists/karmic-updates/Release  Unable to find expected entry  restricted/binary....
did you modify all the lines that contain archive.canonical.com?
yeah i did
or yeah, change your server in software sources
how do i do that ?
that will modify the sources.list file for you
in system → admin → software sources
I don't have that option... synaptic package manager ?
you can access your software sources also in synaptic yeah
in the first tab, it will say "download from"
